meanings.definition: To place in or as if in a coffin.
meanings.sent1: The old man coffined his memories of the war deep within his mind.
meanings.sent2: The funeral director coffined the deceased with care and respect.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel coffined its precious acorn in a secret hiding spot.
meanings.sent4: The darkness of the night coffined the city in an eerie silence.
meanings.sent5: The heavy rain coffined the flowers under a blanket of water.

meanings.definition: To enclose or surround as if with a coffin.
meanings.sent1: The thick fog coffined the town, making it hard to see beyond.
meanings.sent2: The high walls coffined the castle, protecting it from intruders.
meanings.sent3: The cozy blanket coffined the sleeping child in warmth and comfort.
meanings.sent4: The dense forest coffined the hikers in a maze of trees and shadows.
meanings.sent5: The silence of the library coffined the students in a world of books.
